extendedIngredients.originalName: Pinch of freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.original: 1 3-pound butternut squashpeeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch cubes (5 to 6 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: butternut squashpeeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch cubes (5 to 6 cups)

extendedIngredients.original: 3 stalks of celery, chopped (about 1 ½ cups)

extendedIngredients.name: fresh sage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh sage (about 6 large leaves)

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large yellow onion, diced (about 1 ½ cups)

title: Butternut Squash Soup with Sage and Parmesan Croutons
summary: Need a gluten free and primal soup? Butternut Squash Soup with Sage and Parmesan Croutons could be a great recipe to try. One serving contains 185 calories, 5g of protein, and 9g of fat. For $1.3 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up onion, sage, celery, and a few other things to make it today. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 50%. This score is good. Try Butternut Squash Soup with Toasted Sage and Herbed Croutons, Butternut Squash & White Bean Puree with Bacon-Sage Croutons, and Butternut Squash and Parmesan Pasta with Sage for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 F. In a large bowl, toss the squash with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, 2 teaspoons of the salt, and the pepper. Place the squash on a rimmed baking sheet and roast in oven for 15 minutes. Turn the cubes over and continue roasting for 15 minutes or until they are caramelized; set aside.                                                                                                In a Dutch oven or a large stockpot, heat the butter and the remaining oil over medium heat. Add the onion, celery, and sage and saut, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are translucent and tender, 10 minutes. Add the squash, broth, and the remaining salt and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the liquid is flavorful. Remove from heat. Using a blender or a food processor, blend the soup in batches until smooth. Return to the pot and keep warm. Top with Sage and Parmesan Croutons and the grated Parmesan

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 F. In a large bowl, toss the squash with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, 2 teaspoons of the salt, and the pepper.
Place the squash on a rimmed baking sheet and roast in oven for 15 minutes. Turn the cubes over and continue roasting for 15 minutes or until they are caramelized; set aside.
In a Dutch oven or a large stockpot, heat the butter and the remaining oil over medium heat.
Add the onion, celery, and sage and saut, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are translucent and tender, 10 minutes.
Add the squash, broth, and the remaining salt and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 30 minutes or until the liquid is flavorful.
Remove from heat. Using a blender or a food processor, blend the soup in batches until smooth. Return to the pot and keep warm. Top with Sage and Parmesan Croutons and the grated Parmesan
